answers.answer: Dear jada,This is a type of Polyneuropathy, which is manifesting as "Glove and Stoking" pattern.It means that the symptoms will be in the areas where gloves and/or stocking are worn(in a simple layman terms).There and be a lot of reasons for the same.However Diabetes is the most common cause.The other causes can be -1) Genetic Diseases,2) Leprosy,3) Toxicity due to high Alcohol intake, drugs, metal poisoning.4) Vitamin Deficiency, etc5) Other causes.The name , hence would be determined, by the diagnosis.Request you to meet your General Practitioner for a detailed check up and then arrive at the root cause for further management.Feel free for more discussionRegards

question: I've had numbness and tingling in my fingers and some of my toes in which the diagnosis turned out to be a mild polyneuropathy. The EMG/NCS confirmed to be mostly a sensory loss in my fingers/ and toes.. Is there a name for this type of polyneuropathy?
title: Is there a name or type of polyneuropathy this is?
